    • Constructor Detail

      • Search

        public Search(char[][] environment,
              int startPosX,
              int startPosY,
              Node goalNode,
              java.util.List<Portal> portals)
        Creates a new Search instance that can search for a goal in a given environment
        Parameters:
        environment - The environment to be used in the form of a char[][], 'x' denotes a wall, 'g' a goal and 's' the start point
        startPosX - The X-Coordinate of the start point in the environment array. char[y][x]
        startPosY - The X-Coordinate of the start point in the environment array. char[y][x]
        goalNode - A node which coordinates are the goal
        portals - If portals should be used in the search, they must be added as a list, if portals should not be used the list must be empty

    • Method Detail

      • aStarSearch

        public Path aStarSearch()
        Starts an AStar Search on the environment
        Returns:
        The shortest path to the goal, if a path is found. Else the empty Path is returned

      • expandNode

        private void expandNode(Node currentNode)
        Expands the current node. All reachable neighbours of the current node are added to the _openList, if there is not already a shorter path to this node
        Parameters:
        currentNode - the node to expand

      • getNeighbours

        private java.util.List<Node> getNeighbours(Node node)
        Returns all reachable neighbours of a node. If a neighbour is a portal, the other entrance of the portal is returned in the list.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to get the neighbours for
        Returns:
        All neighbours are returned as a list

      • addNeighbour

        private void addNeighbour(java.util.List<Node> nodes)
        Adds the node for the current position the specified nodes list, if it is not a portal. If it is the other entrance of the portal is added
        Parameters:
        nodes - the list to add the node to

      • isPortalEntrance

        private boolean isPortalEntrance(Node node)
        Checks if the specified node is the entrance of a portal in _portals If node is a portal entrance, _selected portal is set to the portal containing the node.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to check
        Returns:
        true if node is an entrance of a portal, false if not

      • f

        private int f(Node node)
        Return the f-Value of the specified node
        Parameters:
        node - The node to calculate the f-Value for
        Returns:
        f-Value

      • f

        private int f(Node node,
              int costOfPathToNode)
        Return the f-Value of the specified node
        Parameters:
        node - The node to calculate the f-Value for
        costOfPathToNode - the cost of a path to the node
        Returns:
        f-Value

      • cost

        private int cost(Node node)
        The cost of a path to the specified node
        Parameters:
        node - The node to calculate the cost for
        Returns:
        cost of a path to the node

      • h

        private int h(Node node)
        The heuristic value for a node
        Parameters:
        node - the node to compute the heuristic value for
        Returns:
        heuristic value

      • distance

        private int distance(Node a,
                     Node b)
        The shortest possible distance between two nodes.
        Parameters:
        a - Node a
        b - Node b
        Returns:
        distance between a and b

      • setSleepTime

        public void setSleepTime(int duration)

      • oppositeDirection

        private char oppositeDirection(char direction)
        Takes a direction as a char and returns the opposite direction
        Parameters:
        direction - a direction ('u', 'r', 'd', 'l')
        Returns:
        the opposite direction to the specified one

      • move

        private void move(char direction)
        Changes the values of currentPosX or currentPosY to move in the specified diretion
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction to move to

      • moveTo

        private void moveTo(Node position)
        Changes the values of currentPosX or currentPosY to move to position specified in the Node that gets passed to the method
        Parameters:
        position - The Node containing the information where to move

      • printEnvironment

        public void printEnvironment(Node addedNode)
        Prints the environment and marks the specified node as visited in the environment
        Parameters:
        addedNode - the node to mark in the environment

      • print

        private void print()
        Prints the current environment

      • printPathInEnvironment

        private void printPathInEnvironment(Path path)
        Resets the current environment and marks the nodes on the path as visited. Goals, start points and portals will not be marked
        Parameters:
        path - the path to mark
